title: Initialize Python project structure
description:
## Context
Set up the foundational Python project with modern tooling. This is the first task and blocks everything else.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** haiku
**Estimated Duration:** 1h
**Approach:** Use uv or poetry for dependency management. Follow src layout convention.

## Implementation Steps
1. Create `pyproject.toml` with project metadata, Python 3.11+ requirement
2. Set up directory structure: `src/station_chief/{server,cli,web,adapters,data}`
3. Add `__init__.py` files with version
4. Add core dependencies: fastapi, uvicorn, sqlalchemy, alembic, typer, rich, httpx, gitpython, pydantic, python-dotenv, jinja2
5. Add dev dependencies: pytest, pytest-asyncio, ruff, mypy
6. Create initial `README.md` with project description
7. Add `.gitignore` for Python projects
8. Initialize git repository

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `uv sync` or `poetry install` succeeds
- [ ] `python -c "import station_chief"` works
- [ ] Directory structure matches architecture
- [ ] All dependencies install without conflicts

## Files Likely Involved
- pyproject.toml (new)
- src/station_chief/__init__.py (new)
- src/station_chief/{server,cli,web,adapters,data}/__init__.py (new)
- README.md (new)
- .gitignore (new)

title: Configure development tooling

title: Set up SQLAlchemy + Alembic
description:
## Context
Establish the database layer with ORM and migrations. This is foundational for all data models.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** sonnet
**Estimated Duration:** 1.5h
**Approach:** Use SQLAlchemy 2.0 style with async support. SQLite for simplicity.

## Implementation Steps
1. Create `src/station_chief/data/database.py` with engine, session factory
2. Create `src/station_chief/data/models/base.py` with declarative base, common mixins (id, timestamps)
3. Set up Alembic: `alembic init alembic`
4. Configure `alembic.ini` and `alembic/env.py` for async SQLAlchemy
5. Create initial migration (empty, just sets up alembic_version)
6. Add database URL config via environment variable with SQLite default
7. Create `src/station_chief/data/repositories/base.py` with generic CRUD repository
8. Add tests for database connection and session

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Database engine creates SQLite file
- [ ] `alembic upgrade head` runs successfully
- [ ] `alembic revision --autogenerate` works
- [ ] Session factory provides working sessions
- [ ] Base repository CRUD methods work

title: Harness adapter base class
description:
## Context
Define the plugin interface that all harness adapters must implement.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** sonnet
**Estimated Duration:** 1h
**Approach:** Abstract base class with clear interface. Registry pattern for discovery.

## Implementation Steps
1. Create `src/station_chief/adapters/base.py` with HarnessAdapter ABC
2. Define abstract methods:
   - `name` property (e.g., 'claude-code')
   - `display_name` property (e.g., 'Claude Code')
   - `discover_global()` -> list of config paths
   - `discover_project(path)` -> list of config paths
   - `parse_config(path)` -> parsed config dict
   - `get_skills_path(scope, project_path?)` -> path for skill installation
   - `install_skill(skill, scope, project_path?)` -> installed path
3. Create `src/station_chief/adapters/registry.py` with adapter registration
4. Add `get_adapter(name)` and `list_adapters()` functions
5. Add tests for registry

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] HarnessAdapter ABC defined with all methods
- [ ] Registry can register and retrieve adapters
- [ ] `list_adapters()` returns registered adapters
- [ ] Tests pass

## Files Likely Involved
- src/station_chief/adapters/__init__.py (new)

## Context
Expose skill source management via REST API.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** sonnet
**Estimated Duration:** 1.5h
**Approach:** Standard CRUD plus sync trigger endpoint.

2. Create `src/station_chief/server/api/sources.py` router
3. Implement `GET /api/sources` - list all sources
4. Implement `POST /api/sources` - add source {name, type, url}
5. Implement `GET /api/sources/{id}` - get source with sync status

7. Implement `POST /api/sources/{id}/sync` - trigger sync
8. Add to main app router
9. Add tests

- [ ] Can list sources with status
- [ ] Can trigger sync
- [ ] Can remove source

title: Sync protocol
description:
## Context
Design and implement the client-server synchronization protocol.

## Implementation Hints

**Recommended Model:** opus
**Estimated Duration:** 2h
**Approach:** Timestamp-based delta sync, last-write-wins for conflicts.

## Implementation Steps
1. Create `src/station_chief/cli/sync/protocol.py`
2. Define sync request/response schemas
3. Implement push logic:
   - Collect dirty items from cache
   - Send to server /api/sync/push
   - Clear dirty flags on success
4. Implement pull logic:
   - Send last_synced timestamp
   - Receive changed items from server
   - Update local cache
5. Handle conflicts with last-write-wins
6. Track conflicts for user review
7. Update server /api/sync endpoints
8. Add comprehensive tests

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Push sends local changes to server
- [ ] Pull receives server changes
- [ ] Conflicts detected and tracked
- [ ] Last-write-wins applied
- [ ] Tests pass

## Files Likely Involved
